...completely different. Okay so if you've been following this sketchblog since it started in 2005, you've seen sketches, doodles, works in progress, and whatever is the end result of putting pencil or pen to paper. But never once, photos...I'm about to change that, right now. So you've seen the end result of working on art right? Well now let's take a look at the things that are used to make said art... My tablet! Can't get much digital art done without it! Well you can with a mouse but seeing as I don't have the coordination(lol left handed!...I use this. Now this tablet was a gift from Christmas '07! So instead of wasting all the printer paper in the house, enter one of my two sketchbooks and epic electric eraser. This black one is for all the detailed stuff, and the sketch you see is of this. And for those moments when some printer paper has been stolen borrowed, we have the clipboard of doom! Actually this is really handy, it has this little compartment for holding pens, paper, candy...all the tools for an artist. Ladies and gentlemen, you CANNOT CREATE DIGITAL ART WITHOUT A COMPUTER! Do not believe what anyone has told you, for computers=digital and that is all you need to know! Yeah...darn people, telling me I can make digital art without a computer, damn them...DAMN THEM TO HELL!!!!!! And the wallpaper seen here is this made by yours truly! Oh man I love this thing! I've read about people using electric erasers and one day I managed to pop into an art supply store(as I have a tendency to do, also with game, book and computer stores), saw they had one eraser in stock and bam! I bough it, sketching has never been the same since...And here's the box it came in :P! The markers I NEVER USE...but I want to use them. Thing is, I'm afraid to use them. Unlike with photoshop/painter/openCanvas/paint tool SAI/ traditional media has NO UNDO BUTTON...but I guess the only way I'll get half descent at using them is to practise, so someone over the summer, poke me on MSN or AIM and say "LEAH GO USE UR MARKERZ NAO PLZKTHX!". The copics I got at last year's Anime North, and hope to get some more and the Prismacolors were a christmas present in 2005, need to rebuy certain shades and get more fleshtones. And here we see the tablet in use, with the smudgeguard. Yes my nails are naturally long, and I love me my french manicures. Also, LOL LEFT HANDER! My other sketchbook, the sketchbook for anatomy practise and random ideas :P. And behold...I like drawing bald characters! I find I'm able to work a lot better with a little music...and cleaning supplies apparently... My pencils let me show you them. Also have a couple erasers and junk in there. Alright you've seen what I work with, now it's work in progress time! My next website layout, I want to have an area for wip screenshots and one for recent gallery updates, hence the little boxes on the left hand side. Then I looked at what I had made and said, "You know...lemme make something at actually features something I've drawn!" So I'll try and doodle up something when I have free time. And last but not least... Guess who learned about the wonderful world of textures? Why does shading clothing take so long? Also would someone like to teach me how to shade clothes? No really...*headdesk*. MOAR TEXTUREZ! Also, I'm tacking a crack at a little pencil lineart, wish me luck! And here you have it, want to finish at least one of those images and then finally work on some gift art I owe people, all while trying to not be driven insane by school and my oh so non stress inducing job D:! So that's it for now, more to come hopefully soon! -

What a fitting name, I really wish I had more time to update this blog, I almost debate whether or not to make my sketch/wip posts over at my new site's blog section...but for me to do that, I would actually need to have FREE TIME to work on new art and things like that >_> and also, still love livejournal and this little blog*squeeze*. But anyways, I'll save my rants about my lovely job for , now is a time for ART! So it's been a little while since my last post and I'm sure you're wondering what I've been up to artistically. Well I launched my site on November 25th and I'm quite proud of that, seeing an idea and a dream come to reality always feels good... Yup this little bit of chibi was one of the first pieces of art you would see when you enter the site. To date it was one of the fastest pieces of cg art I've made, 7, 8 hours of inking in painter, while SICK(usually takes me upwards of 10 and 12 hours-must be a sign I'm getting the hang of digital inking), and 6 hours to cel-shade it in photoshop...why was I using the pen tool to shade before XD? I really need to try regular sized cel-shaded characters. Man, just looking at this, if I had the time, I'm tempted to resurrect my gaia art shop or see how I'd fare in one of those art auctions cause I really want both the angelic and nitemare mini wings, then I can die a happy gaian XD! So in deviantart, I wanted a new avatar to replace the one I had for halloween...you know what happened next... So I've been making making really simple looking pixel avatars right? Well the thing that got me into making the avatars was this gallery. Loved Rhu's artstyle for some time and those avatars are adorable ;___;! So I always tried making on with little success. Problem was, I kept putting in too much detail and after all, it's a 50x50 picture so it can't be as detailed as a full cg. So one day, while reading through tutorials and getting pointers from , this is the end result. Now that I know to make a rough sketch, then outline with the line too...I gotta try making more and better ones, featuring my oc's and stuff. So I had my site going for a little while, and every time I looked at it, I wasn't too happy. For one I tried using Dreamweaver's template option to quickly make my pages. Now I'm not sure if it's because I FAIL or am a n00b at making sites still, but everytime a section would load, the images that would make up the layout would take their sweet time to show up. That and the simpleness of the layout made me decide for a change... So like the cut title says, you can get inspiration from anywhere and for me, it was a tutorial. I really liked the background, so I whipped up a psd file, made the background and the container sections. After that, I went with my own thing. With this layout, I said GTFO with dreamweaver templates and following tutorials only from Tutvid(good beginner tutorials but I do know something about webdesign) and decided to apply what I know about CSS. Don't know why I was having a hard time slicing this...oh right, it was my second time slicing a layout to export it to dreamweaver. Oh well, I learn something new each time I play around with this, and big thanks to my buddy Maria for showing me how this should be sliced, cause we both know, if left to my own devices, I would have had over 9000 slices D:! With slices ready, css files written, it was time to rebuild tranquil solace, and the first thing up was the index page... Sometimes it's nice to remind yourself where to put your webcounter :P! So after about 2 and a half days of formatting and recoding, I give you the end result... So nice being able to use 200x40 banners instead of tiny ones for everything. If you want to see the layout in action, GO TO MY SITE :P! Man I really need to start pimping out the place... So while working on that, Christmas came and went.... Note to self: It's "season's" not "season" and making snowmen is fun :3! Hopefully this makes up for my little abscence, as always, forgive me :(. In the mean time, enjoy the artistic goodies for that's all for now! -

Good grief, it's been about a month and a little bit since I've updated this. My only excuse is my overly demanding job that leaves me with little to no quiet time. And with the little quiet time I have, I'm way to tired to do anything artsy. But luckily, according to my schedule I'll have more time at home and I'm hoping and praying I'm not called during the week because having a life is a little(read A LOT) more important than Walmart and their low, low prices. And now for the artwork! So like all the cool people with personal webpages, mine will have a contact form(to email me) when finished. So while googling on how to make a contact form, I came across a free php script. And part of the script calls for a "thank you" page when the mail message goes through and an error one...so here we have a happy little envelope that's being sent to my inbox 8D! This is what happens when you get new photoshop brushes :P! If you're the unlucky soul who manages to mess up on filling out a REALLY simple email form, you're gonna get this D:! Still have a lot to type out for each page, but I'll get it done! Even if they have to drag my dead body from the pc, I'll do it! Moving along, with all the pages that need to be typed and artwork that needs to be watermarked and uploaded to a gallery in order for the site to be complete, there needs to be a front page... I've noticed something! A lot of the artists I admire have some sort of mascot. Bara-chan has her gorgeous artwork of her ragnarok online characters. Kaze-hime has Holly Bunny and rabbits in general(dammit why didn't I think of that? I love rabbits!!), Finni has her digimon OC Finnimon and this adorable girl and the list goes on...so what does Leah have? Well she has original characters*cough*Gin,Yasu,Tama,Cain, athropomorphic vector fruit, graphic tablets or whatever I think of vectoring and also...chariactures of myself! For you see, I've been drawing anime versions of myself and characters that are related to me for some time now. So there you have it, the site mascot is the Artist herself. Oh and I learned that those lovely people in Japan pronounce the name "Leah" as "Riia" and not as "Reafu" as I've been wrongly saying for the past 13 years(remember kids, wapanese, bad name generators and wanting to sound so informed don't mix...but it's hard to get rid of old screen names). Oh and two things, it's "Lee-ah" not "Lay-uh", and no those aren't dreadlocks, they are hair twists :P! That reminds me...I need to microbraid my hair XD! And there you have it, here's hoping I get this site up and running and finish all the wip's I have sitting on my hard drive. So that's all for now! -

Fate has smilled upon me, for I have a short work week YAY! I think I'll use the gray one for deviantArt and signatures. Now to get to the job of coding the site :P! And last but not least, a little something for my psp... Now if only I didn't accidentally wipe my saved game files in order to upload this to my memory stick -_-! Well that's all for the time being! -

So I've been writing about it for a little while now at , but I'm making a personal webpage. But hey this is my first website layout and I've done it all on my own, I can be a little proud right? Now websites aren't just about pretty graphics, as you know, there's also coding... When the website idea first came into my head, I thought that if I made something really simple, I could type something out in notepad, but with dreamweaver everything is incredibly simple(there's even a little button you can press they checks for any errors in coding and any potention problems there can be with different web browsers). Can you imagine yourself having to type out 102 lines of HTML coding, I love that kind of stuff but no thank you! So there you have it, hopefully I'll have everything up and running soon, so that I can go back to actual drawing(after all, if this is to be an online gallery, I need some ART). So that's all for the time being! -

Now just to ink this with my trusty fineliner pens NOT Corel Painter IX.5. And apparently, no artblog post would be complete without...
